notesStmt.note: Stained. Water-damaged. First leaf injured. Heavily water-damaged.
Folio 106r (a vellum end flyleaf): a note in Italian semi-cursive script of the 15th century, headed 'de῾ot ha-filosofim').
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msItem.title: Zohar ḥadash (midrash Rut) זהר חדש (מדרש רות)

supportDesc.extent:
106 folios (+ 3 unfoliated paper flyleaf at the beginning and 3 at the end). 60 folios
45 folios

collation.p:
Quires of mostly 8 leaves each. 2 inner quires are parchment, the rest is paper.
One complete quire of 16 leaves (folios 60-75), one quire of 15 leaves (folios 76-90, missing one leaf at the beginning), and the last quire of 15 leaves (folios 91-105, missing one leaf at the end).

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Italian and Sefardi semi-cursive scripts of the 15th century. Italian semi-cursive script of the 15th century. Sefardi semi-cursive of the 15th century.

binding.p: BM/BL in-house. Spine: 'Perush Hat-Tephilloth. Etc. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Additional 27,009.'

history.provenance:
Acquisition:
Giuseppe Almanzi (b. 1801, d. 1860), bibliophile his manuscript no. 119; his library including 322 medieval Hebrew manuscripts were purchased en bloc by the British Museum through Asher & Co. in October 1865 for £1,000 through Asher & Co., Berlin dealer to the British Museum (see 131-153); inscribed, folio [107v].
